Posts.Content: DivaJMusic wrote: I am just curious at what point did you return to work after BMX?  Did you work through Chemo/RADS?  I live alone and am solely dependent on myself financially and I am just curious what path you took.  I know every case and individual are different but I'd love to hear from you. [DD AC+T 12 treatments 12/17/10 - 4/15/11] [BMX & TAH 11/9/10 BRCA1+ Dx @ age31] Dx 9/24/2010, IDC, 4cm, Stage IIA, Grade 3, 0/6 nodes, ER+/PR-, HER2- Surgery 11/9/2010 Lymph node removal: Left, Right, Underarm/Axillary; Mastectomy: Left, Right; Prophylactic ovary removal Chemotherapy 12/17/2010 Adriamycin (doxorubicin), Cytoxan (cyclophosphamide), Taxol (paclitaxel), Taxotere (docetaxel) Hormonal Therapy 6/27/2011 Femara (letrozole) Hormonal Therapy 3/21/2012 Log in to post a reply
Posts.Title: Did you work? DivaJMusic Dee2010

Posts.Content: DivaJMusic wrote: I got the news Friday, high-grade ductal carcinoma.  At this time they are unable to determine if it is in situ or invasive, but invasive carcinoma is favored.  I am 31 and in complete shock.  All I want to do is scream strings of expletives.  I am going for an MRI on Wednesday and then I will have the swab for the DNA testing Thursday.  I have no idea of my family history as my mother was adopted (and has suffered no BC and I do not know my biological father).  Whew...    [DD AC+T 12 treatments 12/17/10 - 4/15/11] [BMX & TAH 11/9/10 BRCA1+ Dx @ age31] Dx 9/24/2010, IDC, 4cm, Stage IIA, Grade 3, 0/6 nodes, ER+/PR-, HER2- Surgery 11/9/2010 Lymph node removal: Left, Right, Underarm/Axillary; Mastectomy: Left, Right; Prophylactic ovary removal Chemotherapy 12/17/2010 Adriamycin (doxorubicin), Cytoxan (cyclophosphamide), Taxol (paclitaxel), Taxotere (docetaxel) Hormonal Therapy 6/27/2011 Femara (letrozole) Hormonal Therapy 3/21/2012 Log in to post a reply
Posts.Title: tough weekend DivaJMusic chrissyc

Posts.Content: Sep 27, 2010 11:45AM DivaJMusic wrote: They couldn't determine from the sample if it is in situ or invasive, but the report stated that the pathologist favored a diagnosis of invasive vs. in situ.  I am still in such shock.  Thank you all for your kind words.  I am going to seek out some medication for the anxiety.  I just can't wait to stop waking up in the morning and having that feeling that this is all a bad dream.
Posts.Title: tough weekend DivaJMusic chrissyc

Posts.Content: Sep 28, 2010 11:23PM DivaJMusic wrote: Ginny, prayers are always welcome!  Thank you so much.  I am glad you are doing so well.  I am overwhelmed really with this online support system.
Posts.Title: tough weekend DivaJMusic chrissyc

Posts.Content: Sep 28, 2010 01:57PM DivaJMusic wrote: Thank you all so much for your kind words.  I still cannot get over how numb I feel.  I am not really anxious right now, just numb and in shock.  I have a question though, I had my core biopsy a week ago and I am still really sore from it.  It's just a dull achy throb in the tumor itself.  Is this normal?  I am sort of wondering if it's Psychosomatic now that I know what the heck I am dealing with.  lol  I've also stopped "reading ahead".  I only read on what I know in the here and now and will read further as I get more information.
Posts.Title: tough weekend DivaJMusic chrissyc

Posts.Content: May 5, 2011 12:30AM DivaJMusic wrote: I was a gainer, I put on 30 pounds during chemo.  Between the steroids, menopause, general feeling of crappiness and no exercise,  and the total craving of all things JUNK I didn't stand a chance.  I finished chemo 3 weeks ago tomorrow and while I am dropping weight it's slow.  But I've also not been able to get into a routine of exercise as work is about all I can muster.  Whew.  :(
Posts.Title: Weight Gain or Loss During Chemo DebRox jancie

Posts.Content: Oct 4, 2010 11:11AM DivaJMusic wrote: Many hugs and prayers coming your way.
Posts.Title: Waiting on Grandmother's Biopsy.. nnoreen1221 ShelMel

Posts.Content: Dec 18, 2010 07:10AM DivaJMusic wrote: Hi Ladies, wow this last week was busy and a blur.  Port went in on Tuesday and my first DD AC+T treatment was yesterday.  The treatment itself went without a hitch, but by 6 last night I felt like I was coming down with the worst flu of my life.  My whole body ached and in particular my head and my lower back were just miserable.  My body also couldn't decide which way it wanted to void, so I laid very still and did some meditation to avoid either because I loathe both.  Whew.  I feel a little more normal this morning but taking it very slowly.  I notice most people don't start out so heavy on SE?  I never spiked a fever or anything just felt like I wanted to die.
Posts.Title: ACT Dose Dense Cat123 Cat123
